newsitem.title: UK: Wickes scandal implicates more - paper.
newsitem.headline: Wickes scandal implicates more - paper.

text.p: The investigation into Wickes Plc's accounting irregularities is expected to implicate up to four more current or former senior executives of the home improvements retailer, Sunday's Observer newspaper reported. A letter detailing the findings of accountant Price Waterhouse and solicitor Linklaters & Paines, due at the end of September, has been delayed until next week because the investigation, commissioned by Wickes, took longer than expected, the paper said.
Initial findings suggest Wickes' profits were overstated by some 50 million stg, the Observer said.
Rebates that should have been spread over three years were taken into one year's profits, the paper said.
Writedowns to take account of this mean that Wickes is likly to have to launch a 30 million stg rights issue, and may have to sell some of its overseas subsidiaries, the Observer added.
Wickes' trading director Les Rosenthal and commercial director Chris Miles have already resigned following their suspension on June 27.
Shares in Wickes were suspended on June 26 after the irregularities were discovered and Wickes chairman and chief executive Henry Sweetbaum resigned the following day.
